name: Kick-off meeting
description:
• What we'll do
Let's welcome all members and get to know each-other. The 2018 agenda is open so:
- which topics are you interested in?
- which tech-activities will you be willing to participate?
- ideas? sponsors? co-organizers to join the group?
Please come and share whatever expectations you have for this group. We want to listen your voice.
Some snacks will be provided :)

• What to bring

• Important to know
It is very improbable, but in case the avenue changes, please check the meeting details before coming. I will update the information all the time. Are you lost? Here my number:[masked].

name: Machine Learning Study Jam
description:
New to Machine Learning but don’t know where to start? Join us for a Machine Learning Study Jam where we will run through the Machine Learning Crash Course (MLCC)!

This course is intended for those who wish to learn about ML from a practical, applied perspective that will enable you to use machine learning in your everyday projects and learn about the power of TensorFlow. This is a great opportunity for anyone with basic technical knowledge and limited Machine Learning knowledge willing to gain some practical experience in ML and TensorFlow.

This course will be suitable for you, if:
*You are a strong programmer
*Ideally, you are at least somewhat familiar with Python. You don't need to be an expert.
*Ideally, you know at least a little about linear algebra and calculus.
This course is not recommended for:
*Participants with extensive machine learning backgrounds.
*Participants looking to learn about the lower-level intricacies of raw TensorFlow. Although the course does contain some basic TensorFlow exercises, most of the exercises focus on high-level Tensor APIs.
*Participants seeking advanced topics in machine learning such as image convolutional models and recurrent/sequential models.

**Bring your laptop and headphones! **

For the lunch break, you can go out and eat somewhere or bring your food and eat at the venue. Please remember to be back on time for the next modules.

Agenda:
11PM: event start
11:30PM: overview & first 3 modules of MLCC
1:30PM: lunch break
2:30PM: TensorFlow modules
4:00PM: event end

name: Cybersecurity and Data Privacy Tips
description:
In this meetup we will introduce some basic security and privacy recommendations while browsing in Internet, using your smartphone or checking your email.
This talk is targeted for non-technical people or technical people who never care about cybersecurity nor data privacy. We will show why these topics are very important in your daily life, even when your main defensive argument is the sentence: "I have nothing to hide"
Agenda:
First talk 30 min
Pause 20 min
Second talk 30 min

name: DACHFest 2018 (DevFest DACH)
description:
For this year's DevFest season, GDG and WTM communities of Germany, Austria, and Switzerland are all working together to organize our largest event yet: DACHFest!

DACHFest is a two-day DevFest conference focused on making a difference. Meet technology experts, discover all the different ways in which emerging technology is transforming lives, find out how to make your apps and websites friendly towards everyone, learn the secrets of building and nurturing a diverse community — let our speakers surprise and inspire you! And don't forget to make new friends: there will be plenty of opportunities to meet people passionate about your favorite things. ❤️

Join us in Munich on November 10–11 for two days full of talks, workshops, showcases, networking, and fun!

DACHFest is a paid event, but diversity scholarships are available for people who belong to underrepresented groups in tech or cannot afford a ticket.

Website: https://dachfest.com
Twitter: https://twitter.com/dachfest
